item.name: Assassin's Knife
entries: Several curls of sharpened metal branch off the blade of this black knife. When you finish a long rest, you can speak a creature's true name, which designates it as your target.

No creatures other than you and the target can see or otherwise perceive the dagger through nonmagical means, and it cannot harm creatures other than the target. The first time you hit the target, the hit is a critical hit and deals the maximum possible damage. If the creature dies, the dagger becomes visible.

item.name: Bag of Dragon's Teeth
entries: Inside this cloth bag are 10 ({@dice 4d4}) dragon's teeth. You can spend 10 minutes planting and watering any number of these teeth, which grow into a {@creature guard} after another minute passes. The DM has the guards' statistics.
Each guard is an undead, rather than a humanoid, and understands all languages you know but can't speak. The undead guard persists until it is reduced to 0 hit points.

item.name: Bag of Tricks, Red
entries: This ordinary bag, made from red leather, appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object.

You can use an action to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a d6 and consulting the table. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.
The creature is neither friendly nor hostile to you or your companions when it appears; it instead acts in accordance with its wishes and nature.
Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Black Alchemy Jug
entries: This black steel jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds, whether full or empty. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the jug when it is shaken, even if the jug is empty.

You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can uncork the jug as an action and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.
Once the jug starts producing a liquid, it can't produce a different one, or more of one that has reached its maximum, until the next dawn.

item.name: Bow of the Rider of the White Horse
entries: When the first of the seven seals of divine wrath are broken and the scroll beneath is opened, a divine rider on a white horse will appear, carrying this bow. The rider and its three brethren will receive the authority to kill a quarter of all living beings on the Material Plane.

This brilliant bow, made of spotless white wood and decorated with gold-leaf whorls in the shape of wings, carries with it the terrible authority of the Heavens. It was not crafted by mortal or immortal hands, but brought into existence by the divine.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: The bow of the rider of the white horse is a magic weapon that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The bow also functions as a {@item ring of necrotic resistance|dmg} and an {@item oathbow|dmg}.

entries.name: Conjure Mount
entries: While carrying this bow, you can cast {@spell find steed} at will.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The bow has the following randomly determined properties, as described in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial properties}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial property}
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental property}

entries.name: Godly Blessing
entries: If you are of Lawful or Good alignment, you gain the following additional benefits:

items: You are immune to poison damage and bludgoening, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
You automatically succeed on all Religion checks.

entries.name: Targeted Destruction
entries: When you roll initiative, you can choose one creature you can see and cause every arrow loosed from the bow to function as an {@item arrow of slaying|dmg}, targeting that creature's type until you are no longer in initiative. You can use this property thrice, and cannot use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Kneel
entries: If you are holding the bow, you can use an action to command all creatures of your choice within 300 feet of you to yield to your conquering authority. Each creature must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target falls prone and is incapacitated for 10 minutes or until you allow it to stand. You can't use this property again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Destroying the Bow
entries: The bow can be destroyed through any means that would destroy any other object, though it is far more durable than a typical weapon and takes incredible power to deal even superficial damage. If destroyed, the bow reappears in a specially-prepared shrine on the Positive Energy Plane.

item.name: Golden Fiddle
entries: This viol is made from solid gold but weighs no more than an ordinary viol and functions normally. A creature that attempts to play the viol without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} fire damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
You can use the fiddle to cast {@spell burning hands}, {@spell command}, {@spell blindness/deafeness}, {@spell fire shield}, {@spell hallow}, and {@spell banishment}.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. While it is on your person, you become reluctant to part with it, take inordinate pride in your musical skills, and feel compelled to show off your treasure anywhere you go. If you encounter another creature with proficiency in musical instruments, you must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become obsessed with challenging that creature to a contest to prove you are the superior musician.

item.name: Goodberry Wine
entries: This gold-colored light-bodied wine often appears in a glass bottle with mistletoe berries etched into its surface or printed on its label. The bottles often appear alone or in a small box that contains 6 bottles. Each bottle contains 1½ pints of wine, which are drunk in ½-cup servings (6 servings).

Drinking a serving of this wine poisons the drinker for 1 hour and provides enough nourishment to sustain it for one day. If a creature drinks more than 3 servings in the same 48-hour period, its weight is doubled, and its appearance becomes flabby and unpleasant to behold. Only mundane methods of weight loss can restore the creature to its previous appearance.

item.name: Hand of Glory
entries: This leathery severed hand of a felonious Medium humanoid is permanently clenched, ready to receive a candle. If a candle placed in the hand is lit, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for another 20. This light is visible only to a creature holding the candle and other creatures it chooses.
If a candle made from corpse-wax is placed within the hand's fingers, the light gains additional properties:

items: The holder can use an action to choose a 300-foot cube within 5 feet of it and attempt to light the candle. The candle will not light if any creature within the cube is conscious
The candle's light penetrates magical darkness and heavy obscuration created by fog, mist, and other airborne shrouds
Ordinary liquids other than milk cannot douse the flame.

item.name: Instrument of Destruction
entries: This musical instrument thrums with destructive power and produces reverberating bass notes. It has six charges, and regains {@dice 1d6+1} charges daily at dawn. You can spend 1 charge to cast {@spell shatter}  (save DC 14). Alternatively, you can spend any number of charges when you cast a spell using this instrument as a focus to deal an additional {@dice 4d8} thunder damage to each creature of your choice affected by the spell, spending 2 points for each creature.

item.name: Monkey's Paw
entries: This monkey's hand has four fingers and a thumb. The thumb and 1 ({@dice 1d4-1}) fingers are curled inward. A creature holding the paw can speak a desire and cast the {@spell wish} spell. The wish can only attempt to accomplish "something beyond the scope of the spell," and the wish is guaranteed to go wrong in the worst way the DM can possibly conceive. Casting wish in this way incurs no penalty for casting other spells afterward.

item.name: Ring of Reckoning
entries: This silver ring with delicate filigree thrums with the resentment of a thousand nephilim souls.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The ring has the following randomly determined properties:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental properties}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental property}

entries.name: Ring of Spell Storing
entries: The ring functions as a {@item ring of spell storing|dmg}, but can store up to 9 levels worth of slots at a time.

entries.name: Ancients' Vengeance
entries: If you store a reckoning spell in this ring and lead a ritual to cast the spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the number of spell slots you contribute is tripled and the ritual requires no special material components.

item.name: Slaver's Whip
item.reqAttune: by a creature of evil alignment
entries: In addition, when you hit a creature with a challenge rating or level lower than your level with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC17 Wisdom saving throw or be knocked prone and become frightened of you for the next minute. A frightened target cannot move and is incapacitated until it is out of the whip's reach.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This whip is cursed, instilling a powerful sense of resentment and rebellion in its' wielder's victims. If a creature rolls a 20 or higher on its saving throw against the Slaver's Whip, it becomes immune to the whip's damage and effects, and has advantage on attack rolls against you for the next 7 days.

item.name: Scales of the Rider of the Black Horse
entries: When the third of the seven seals of divine wrath are broken and the scroll beneath is opened, a divine rider on a black horse will appear, carrying these scales. The rider and its three brethren will receive the authority to kill a quarter of all living beings on the Material Plane.

These burnished brass scales, embedded with onyx and rose gold, carry with them the terrible despair of famine. They were not crafted by mortal or immortal hands, but brought into existence by the divine.

entries.name: Conjure Mount
entries: While carrying these scales, you can cast {@spell find steed} at will.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The bow has the following randomly determined properties, as described in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide:

items: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial properties}
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial property}
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental property}

entries.name: Godly Blessing
entries: If your alignment is neutral, you gain the following additional benefits:

items: You no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe, and are immune to {@condition exhaustion}.
You can cast the {@spell blight} spell (spell save DC 21) at-will, without expending a spell slot.
You automatically succeed on all ability checks that use the Persuasion skill.

entries.name: Ordained Scarcity
entries: You can use an action to name an object, staple, or trade good, such as "silver bullion," "crates," "nails," "wheat plants," or "longswords," and roll a d100. A percentage of the named objects equal to the result rots, rusts, or otherwise becomes useless and unsalvageable. This effect affects the named objects everywhere, in every plane of existence, simultaneously. You can't take this action again for 7 days, and if you roll a 25 or higher to target a certain type of object, you can't name that object again for 30 days.

entries.name: Destroying the Scales
entries: The scales can be destroyed through any means that would destroy any other object, though they are far more durable than a typical set of scales and require incredible power to suffer even the most superficial damage. If destroyed, the scales reappear in a specially-prepared shrine on the positive energy plane.

item.name: Sword of the Rider of the Red Horse
entries: When the second of the seven seals of divine wrath is broken and the scroll beneath is opened, a divine rider on a red horse will appear, with this sword in hand. The rider and its three brethren will receive the authority to kill a quarter of all living beings on the Material Plane.

This terrible sword, made of flawless crimson metal and equipped with an intricate ebony hilt and scabbard in the shape of writhing bodies, carries with it the terrible fury of the Heavens. It was not crafted by moral or immortal hands, but brought into existence by the divine.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: The sword of the rider of the red horse is a magic weapon that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The sword also functions as a {@item sword of answering} and a {@item vorpal sword}.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The bow has the following randomly determined properties, as described in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide:

items: 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial property}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial property}
2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental properties}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental property}

entries.name: Godly Blessing
entries: If your alignment is Lawful, you gain the following additional benefits:

items: You are immune to poison damage and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
You can cast the {@spell blight} spell (spell save DC 21) at-will, without expending a spell slot.
You automatically succeed on all ability checks that use the Animal Handling or Intimidation skills.

entries.name: Apocalyptic Massacre
entries: If you are holding the sword, you can use an action to declare yourself a combatant above all others. For the next hour, you are immune to all damage and conditions, and when you take the Attack action, you can attack twice as many times as you could ordinarily (for example, a 20th-level fighter could make eight attacks, a 20th-level paladin could make four, or a wizard under the effects of the {@spell haste} spell could make four). Once you use this power, you can't do so again for 7 days.

entries.name: Destroying the Sword
entries: The sword can be destroyed through any means that would destroy any other object, though it is far more durable than a typical weapon and takes incredible power to deal even superficial damage. If destroyed, the sword reappears in a specially-prepared shrine on the positive energy plane.

item.name: Assassin's Teapot
entries: This ornate teapot, often made from ceramic or jade, contains a concealed second chamber. This second chamber can be filled through a separate, hidden aperture and is often filled with a poisoned serving of the substance in the primary chamber. The liquid contained in the two chambers remains separated, and by covering a small hole in the handle, the server can change the internal chamber pressure and cause liquid to pour from the second chamber rather than the first. If the server attempts to cover the hole and pour a different liquid, any creature that sees the pourer can make a Wisdom (Perception) check against the pourer's Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) to notice the altered pouring technique.

item.name: Barbed Wire (30 feet)
entries: You can spend one minute anchoring a length of barbed wire between two solid masses, such as fence posts or two walls, using stakes or nails as necessary. When a creature enters the barbed wire's space for the first time on a turn, it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 2d4 piercing damage and is restrained. A target can use its action to attempt to escape, which requires a DC 14 Strength or Dexterity check. Each time a target attempts to escape, it takes another 1d4 piercing damage. The wire's space is difficult terrain.

item.name: Beaked Mask
entries: A symbol of plague and terror, this mask made from thick black leather covers the entire head and features an exaggerated beaked shape at the front, which is reinforced with wood and packed with aromatic herbs. Two glass lenses allow you to see through the mask without exposing your eyes. If you wear this mask while it is packed with aromatics, you have advantage on saving throws against airborne disease and pathogens, clouds of toxic gas (both magical and nonmagical) and other airborne effects. You also lose your sense of smell. You can restore your sense of smell by removing the mask for 1 hour.

item.name: Counterfeit Art Object
entries: This art object resembles one of the {@filter treasures |tables|source=dmg|search=art objects} in the Dungeon Master's Guide, but its true value is only a twentieth of the item it resembles.

A successful Intelligence (Investigation) check eveals the item as a fake. The investigator has disadvantage on the check if it does not have proficiency in the artisan's tools necessary to make the item. The DC for this check is determined by the value of the genuine art object, listed on the Counterfeit Art Object Identification table below.

item.name: Loaded Die
entries: When you make an ability check to play a game of dice and use this die, you have advantage on the check. Whenever you roll a die to determine the number your character rolls, you can reroll the result and use either roll. A loaded die takes the form of one of the dice used to play: a {@dice d4}, a {@dice d6}, a {@dice d8}, a {@dice d10}, a {@dice d12}, or a {@dice d20}. A creature proficient in dice sets can make a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to confirm the die is loaded.

item.name: Aboleth Jelly (1 tablespoon)
entries: This distilled gel taken from aboleth mucus produces a sense of euphoria similar to a brain's experience when deprived of oxygen. A creature that fails its DC 14 Constitution saving throw against this drug is {@condition poisoned} for the next hour.

While poisoned in this way, it suffers 2 levels of exhaustion, has disadvantage on Intelligence saving throws, and is vulnerable to psychic damage. Other creatures with telepathic abilities can initiate a telepathic connection with the poisoned creature, whether it is willing or not.

item.name: Cannabis (1/8 ounce)
entries: The dried leaves of certain hemp plants impart a pleasant high when smoked or used as an ingredient in food. When a creature fails its DC 10 Constituion saving throw against this drug, it enjoys a mild, pleasant high for the next 1d4 hours. For that time, it is poisoned and suffers two levels of exhaustion, which are removed when the high ends. While poisoned in this way, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against enchantment and illusion spells and other effects that confuse, frighten, disorient, or otherwise fool the senses.

item.name: Crystal (1/100 ounce)
entries: This translucent white crystal imparts an incredible rush of energy when crushed and inhaled. Ingestion, and failing a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, immediately grants a creature that uses it the benefits of a long rest. The drug's effects last for 48 hours, during which time it does not need to eat or drink, has advantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that use Strength or Dexterity, and cannot sleep or be put to sleep by spells or other effects. After the high ends, the creature gains 3 levels of exhaustion. A creature experiences heightened anxiety, paranoia, and even hallucinations while under the effects of this drug or addicted to it. It has disadvantage on saving throws against enchantment and illusion spells and other effects that confuse, frighten, disorient, or otherwise fool the senses.

A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug also experiences severe paranoia, a rapidly-shifting mood, and becomes more prone to violent behavior. Often, the creature lashes out without justification. When an addicted user makes a bite attack, roll a d20. On a 1, the user's teeth shatter, and the bite attack becomes unusable unless the creature is targeted with the {@spell regenerate} spell.

item.name: Dreadnought Tears (1 drop)
entries: This translucent liquid distilled from the vitreous fluid of an {@creature astral dreadnought|mtf} wipes away errant thoughts. A creature that fails its DC 18 Constitution saving throw against this drug is poisoned for 8 hours. While poisoned in this way, the creature falls under the effect of the mind blank spell. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it does not benefit from its next long rest as its soul projects into the astral plane. This harmless visit is hazy and distorted, which the target perceives as a terrible series of irrational nightmares.

item.name: Dwale (1 bottle)
entries: This potent alcoholic liquor made from bile, lettuce, bryony root, hemlock, opium, nightshade, and henbane acts as a powerful sleeping draught and anesthetic. A creature that fails its DC 16 Constitution saving throw against this drug is poisoned for 12 hours. While poisoned in this way, the creature is unconscious and cannot be woken by any means, including taking damage or being roused by a noise or other creature.

item.name: Ectoplasm (1 ounce)
entries: When ingested or rubbed into the skin, this translucent blue-white ointment opens the user's eyes to strange dimensions. The creature hallucinates vividly and can use its action to see into the ethereal plane until the end of its next turn. Creatures under the influence of this drug often interpret their visions as visitations from historical figures or important figures from the user's past, and regular users often develop severe self-importance thanks to their alleged ability to speak to the dead.

A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug becomes obsessed with death, places where gruesome and unusual deaths occurred, and places the deceased are interred. In severe cases, the addicted creature may come to believe that it is dead, or has died or miraculously returned to life. It may lash out violently at anyone who attempts to question or contradict this notion.

item.name: Ergot Liqueur (1 bottle)
entries: This mold, often eaten in bread made from contaminated grain, produces powerful hallucinations. A creature that ingests it and fails its saving throw is poisoned for the next 24 hours. While poisoned in this way, the creature experiences mild hallucinations that cause it to perceive its surroundings and creatures near it in terrifying and confusing ways.

A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug has disadvantage on saving throws against all illusion and enchantment spells and similar effects as it struggles to differentiate between delusion and reality. It also experiences gangrene in its fingers and toes, which becomes the {@table lignering injuries|dmg|Festering Wound} lingering injury after 1 month without treatment (whether or not the creature remains addicted).

item.name: Fairy Dust (1 ounce)
entries: This gold powder with an iridescent sheen is made from the ground wings of Tiny fey, and is snorted through the nostrils. A creature that fails its saving throw against fairy dust is affected by the {@spell hypnotic pattern} spell for one hour as it hallucinates vividly. A creature that rolls a 20 or higher on its saving throw instead gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed for one minute.

item.name: Gelatinous Cube Extract (1 teaspoon)
entries: When swallowed, this mostly-harmless translucent blue gel induces a pleasant numbness in the extremities and minor intoxication. It has a savory flavor and is often spread on bread. A creature that ingests gelatinous cube extract is vulnerable to acid damage for one hour.

item.name: Green Ointment (1 bottle)
entries: This sticky green gel derived from the leaves of a variety of plants (such as hemlock, nightshade, jimsonweed, or henbane) produces powerful hallucinations. When a creature applies this ointment and fails its DC 15 Constitution saving throw, it is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition incapacitated}, and cannot move for the next hour. In this state, the target concentrates on the {@spell arcane eye} spell ({@spell dispel magic} DC 10), even if it cannot cast the spell normally. The eye has a speed of 150 feet instead of 30.

A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug experiences severe nightmares. When the target attempts to take a long rest, it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit from the rest.

item.name: Frenzy Ash (1 ounce)
entries: This dry, off-white powder inhaled through the nose fills a creature that fails it DC 20 Constitution saving throw against it with incredible energy, potent confidence, and euphoria. For the next {@dice 1d4} hours, the target has advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks, ability checks made to craft items, and saving throws against being frightened or put to sleep. Its speed also increases by 10 feet. For {@dice 1d6+1} hours after the high ends, the target has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws and saves to maintain concentration on a spell.

A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug experiences potent cravings for more frenzy ash, and will often do anything it can to obtain additional doses of the drug. It also has disadvantage on saving throws against inhaled poisons and airborne effects such as a green dragon's breath or the cloudkill spell. It also loses interest in other experiences it might enjoy, such as good food, time spent with loved ones, or its hobbies.

item.name: Mummia (1 ounce)
entries: Users of this ground powder made from desiccated ancient corpses can mix it into beverages or honey for consumption, combine it with water to make a medicinal salve, or apply it to wounds directly. A creature that applies a dose of mummia to a wound and fails its DC 14 Constitution saving throw regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points. A creature that ingests it and fails its save can cure one nonmagical disease affecting it. If drunk in a beverage before a long rest, a creature that fails its saving throw regains one additional hit die.

A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to mummia is afflicted with {@creature mummy} rot (Monster Manual page 228) until it consumes one dose of mummia, which temporarily alleviates the curse and restores the creature's maximum hit points to their original amount. This curative does not increase the creature's current hit points. If a creature goes 24 hours without consuming a dose of mummia, its renewed maximum hit points are again reduced by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) as normal.

item.name: Opium (1 ounce)
entries: This sticky, strong-smelling gum extracted from the seed capsules of specially-bred poppy plants can be smoked, ingested, or even distilled into poison. A creature that fails its DC 17 Constitution saving throw against this drug experiences a euphoric rush and is {@condition poisoned} for the next hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target ignores the effects of {@table lingering injuries} that do not remove body parts. It can also use an action to suffer one level of {@condition exhausted|exhaustion} to roll a hit die and regain hit points as it would during a short rest, without expending a hit die. If the target fails its saving throw against this drug by 5 or more, it instead falls {@condition unconscious} for the next {@dice 1d6 + 2} hours.
A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug experiences potent cravings for more opium, and will often do anything it can to obtain additional doses of the drug.

item.name: Peyote (1 pound)
entries: This small, spineless cactus contains chemicals that produce a mild state of altered perception. When a creature fails its saving throw against this drug, it rolls on the table below, choosing from one of the following effects:.

rows: The creature comes under the effects of the {@spell detect magic} spell for 1 hour. Magic appears as brilliantly-colored distortions in the creature's field of view.
The creature comes under the effects of the {@spell commune with nature} spell for 1 hour.
Any curses affecting the creature are removed for the duration.
Any {@variantrule madness} the creature suffers is suppressed for 1 month.
The creature's perception of color intensifies.
The creature's sense of time changes, allowing it to ponder and consider problems over the next hour, but that it perceives as weeks or months.

item.name: Powdered Ivory (1 ounce)
entries: This gritty white powder, often made from the horns, tusks, or teeth of elephants, mammoths, narwhals, dragons, or other exotic creatures is believed to increase virility and restore youthfulness. It has no effect whatsoever.

item.name: Silphium Resin (1 ounce)
entries: When mixed with wine or cooked into food, the resin of this rare aromatic herb with heart-shaped leaves act as a powerful aphrodisiac and potent contraceptive for {@dice 1d4} hours after ingestion. It is not addictive and has no other effects, though its heart-shaped leaves are a delicious seasoning when dried.

item.name: Snakebite (1/100 ounce)
entries: This thin, tar-colored liquid placed within the bulb of a magically-extracted snake fang combines with potent venom to induce a pleasurable rush when injected. After the initial burst of energy, a user who fails its DC 25 Constitution saving throw experiences a potent high and is {@condition poisoned} for the next {@dice 1d4 + 1} hours. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target suffers 3 levels of {@condition exhaustion}, which are removed when the high ends. It also ignores the effects of any {@table lingering injuries} that do not remove body parts, and fails all saving throws against extreme cold and spells and other effects that deal cold damage.
A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to this drug experiences potent cravings for more snakebite, and will often do anything it can to obtain additional doses of the drug.
It also has disadvantage on saving throws against poison and disease, loses any immunities to poison or disease, and must eat twice as much food each day to sustain itself.

item.name: Troll Meat (1 pound)
entries: Once per day when a creature consumes a pound of Troll Meat, its Strength score increases by 1 (to a maximum of 22), and it gains enough nourishment to sustain it for one day. Every day that the creature doesn't consume troll meat, its Strength score decreases by 1 until it returns to its original score.

After the creature participates in combat or another stressful situation (such as intense physical activity, a tense standoff or social situation, or other scenario as determined by the DM), the creature must make a Strength saving throw equal to 15 + the difference between its original Strength score and its increased Strength score.

On a failed save, it falls unconscious for {@dice 1d4} hours. It wakes when it takes damage equal to or greater than its modified Strength score, or another creature uses its action to attempt to wake it. To wake the sleeping user, the creature administering to it must succeed on a Wisdom (Medicine) check with a DC equal to the user's modified Strength score.
If the creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it suffers a heart attack and drops to 0 hit points, and a {@creature troll meat casserole|aaa} emerges from its space and attempts to flee.

A creature with a Strength score increased by this drug experiences severe mood swings, often towards irritability, rage, or depression, and a significant increase in appetite. It also has disadvantage on saving throws against disease, and may be rendered infertile.

item.name: Vrock Dust (1 ounce)
entries: This powder made from the dried spores of a vrock provides a potent, pleasurable high when inhaled. A creature that fails its DC 14 Constitution saving throw this drug is poisoned for the next 10 minutes. While poisoned in this way, the creature is vulnerable to radiant damage and automatically fails any saving throw inflicted by a celestial or fiend.
A creature {@book addicted|AbiDalzims|6|Addiction} to vrock dust experiences potent cravings for more vrock dust, and will often do anything it can to obtain additional doses of the drug.

item.name: Torturer's Implements
additionalEntries: Torture is a sickening, but often necessary, art that produces intangible benefits through unethical means. Proficiency in these foul instruments allows you to coercively extract information from captives through pain. Your cruel skills also give you great insight into the superficial workings of the body and the deepest recesses of the mind.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Torturer's implements include tongs, a pair of pliers, a branding iron, a flaying knife, two pairs of manacles, a short length of chain, a hammer and box of nails, and a pear of anguish. A full set of torturer's implements costs 30 gp and weighs 20 lbs.

additionalEntries.name: Intimidation
entries: You can use the components of your torturer's implement to make veiled, wordless threats in conversation. For instance, you can drum your fingertips on the handle of a razor while in conversation, or click tongs in the face of a potential victim to terrify them before the session begins.

additionalEntries.name: Medicine
entries: When you study an injured or dead creature, your knowledge can help you understand the circumstances of and intent behind its wounds. You also have intimate knowledge of pain and nonlethal injuries, and how to best to both cause and treat them.

additionalEntries.name: Insight
entries: Your skill with torturer's implements allows you to determine the truth and intent behind the statements of a creature in pain or under duress, whether or not you caused its distress.

additionalEntries.caption: Torturer's Implements
rows: Coerce information from a strong-willed creature
Compel a fantatic to publicly recant
Modify a creature's memory of an event
Force a creature to adopt new beliefs

item.name: Hirelings, Criminal
entries: Experts able to perform immoral tasks outside the bounds of law don't fall into the category of ordinary hirelings. It is easy to find someone foolish or desperate enough to commit a crime. To find someone able to break the law, complete their task, evade capture, and uphold their unwritten contract requires much more effort. Without a network of well-organized lawbreakers, adventurers must take great care in their diligent search for contractors—for whom avoiding discovery is a core career skill.

Once found, these figures often charge exorbitant sums for their efforts. These one-time purchases send the criminal on a specific mission, such as to rob a single cathedral or plunder a single ship. This price represents the cost of their expertise, their confidentiality, and the purchase of necessary additional equipment, bribes, and other tools of the trade.
If a job requires multiple skills, then the total cost of each component is doubled to represent the additional demand for elite criminals or coordinated teams of skilled outlaws.

For example, an assassin who must break into a castle (50 gp) to kill a high-value target (2,500) charges 5,100 gp for the job. Similarly, a pirate captain hired to attack another ship (1,500 gp), kidnap and enslave the crew (200 gp), and smuggle them into a nation where slavery is illegal (2,000 gp) would charge 7,400 gp.

spell.name: Acid Bubble
entries: You play a discordant note on the horn, which blows a cloud of acrid bubbles from its bell that floats in a straight line toward a point within range. If the bubbles strike a creature or object, they pop. The target and all creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

If the bubbles do not strike a creature, they hover at the chosen point in a 5-foot cube until the spell ends or they pop. The bubbles pop if a creature moves into their space, touches them, or attacks them. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) moves the bubbles in the direction of the wind
at a rate of 10 feet per round.

m.text: a horn worth 5 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st. In addition, when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the size of the cube increases to 10 feet. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the cube increases to 15 feet, and a spell slot of 7th level or higher increases it to 20 feet. A 5-foot cube of bubbles, rather than the entire cloud, pop when contacted or attacked.

spell.name: Acid Pit
entries: You excavate a 10-foot deep, 30-foot-radius pit filled with bubbling acid centered on a point on the ground you can see within range. When the pit appears, each creature within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 7d8} acid damage and falls to the bottom of the pit. Creatures with a flying or swimming speed take damage on a failed save, but remain on the surface instead. Creatures that cannot move automatically fail the saving throw.
On a success, a creature moves up to its speed to the edge of the pit.

When a creature ends its turn within the pit, it takes an additional {@damage 3d8} acid damage. Creatures can swim or otherwise move through the acid as if it were water. When the spell ends, the acid dissipates into vapor, but the pit remains.

m.text: a lemon and a trowel, both of which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Arsonist's Lullaby
entries: You play a soothing 10-minute song that gathers and stores energy in a point you can see within range. 8 hours after you cast the spell, a 100-foot cube of flame explodes from the point, dealing 25 fire damage to every creature, structure, and object not being worn or carried within the area. The flames spread at a rate of 5 feet per round in every direction, provided the surface is flammable and has fuel to burn. Every creature and object that enters the flames for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 5 fire damage. The flames are not magical and can be extinguished by any means that could put out normal flames, and die out 24 hours after bursting into flame.

m.text: a musical instrument worth at least 2 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot 5th level or higher, the damage dealt by the spell's initial explosion increases by 5 for every slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Astral Wasp
entries: You touch a willing creature and conjure a magical construct in the shape of an aggressive insect near it, which orbits the target in a 10-foot-radius area and moves with it. When a creature enters or leaves this radius, the target can use its reaction to make a melee spell attack against it, using your spell attack bonus. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} force damage, and the wasp disappears.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot 2nd level or higher, an additional wasp appears for each slot above 1st.

spell.name: Babel's Curse

components.m: a small clay model of a ziggurat

entries: You reach into the mind of a creature within range that knows at least one language and twist its ability to comprehend words. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it loses the ability to speak, read, or write for the duration. Words that the target speaks or inscribes are garbled and unrecognizable as any existing language, and any words that it reads or hears are foreign and unintelligible to it. If the target attempts to cast a spell with a verbal component, it must make an ability check using its spellcasting ability with a DC equal to your spell save DC. On a failure, the spell has no effect, and the slot is wasted.

A creature that can speak all languages or is under the effects of the {@spell tongues} spell can still understand the target, and casting the {@spell tongues} spell on the target immediately ends this spell.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's range increases to "Sight," targets all creatures in a 5-mile radius circle, and its duration to "Until Dispelled." The tongues spell cannot end this spell's effect on a single target unless cast at 9th level.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires the brain of a creature that knows at least 13 languages, which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Boil
entries: You flash-heat a 20-foot-radius sphere of water that you can see within range, which fills with bubbles. Each creature within the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Until the spell ends, the area is heavily obscured, and when a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.
Damage from this spell ignores resistance and immunity to fire damage conferred by being underwater.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of the initial burst and the lingering warmth both increase by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Brain Fog
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of headache-inducing violet smog centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration.

Each creature that enters the cloud on a turn or starts its turn there has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain {@status concentration} on spells and on ability checks or saving throws that use Intelligence or Wisdom, and has resistance to psychic damage, until the start of its next turn.
If a ranged spell attack must enter or pass through the cloud to reach its target, the attack automatically misses.

m.text: a bottle of liquor with high alcohol content, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Brain Storm
entries: You unleash half-formed ideas from the depths of your imagination that whirl around you in a tempest of brilliant flashes for the duration. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it.

Affected creatures in the area are {@condition deafened}, and when a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} psychic or lightning damage (your choice). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

After the spell ends, choose one cantrip that you don't already know from your spell list. You learn that cantrip, and can cast it as you would any other cantrips, until you finish a long rest. If you cast this spell again, you cannot learn a second cantrip, but can choose to replace the first cantrip with another one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Breakaway
entries: You fuse the powers of elemental earth and air to rip a chunk of material out of the ground and lift it into the air. The area can have a radius of up to 30 feet, a height of up to 10 feet, and can be lifted up to 120 feet straight up. If the cylinder and any creature or object on it would collide with another anchored object, such as a balcony or roof, it destroys the obstacle and continues on its course so long as the obstacle is no greater than one-third the cylinder's size. If the obstacle is larger, the cylinder of earth stops.

After it reaches the chosen height, the cylinder remains there for the duration. A strong wind can move the cylinder at a rate of 10 feet per round in its direction. When the spell ends, it descends quickly, but harmlessly, back to its original position.

If you cast this spell on the same place every day for a year, its effect becomes permanent. You can cast this spell on an area that is already permanently affected by it, raising it another 120 feet in the air, returning it to its elevated position when the spell ends.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its area increases to a cylinder with a radius of up to 5 miles and a height of up to 1 mile, and its duration becomes "Until Dispelled." In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires the complete and assembled skeleton of a roc, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Cloud of Capsaicin
entries: You crush the pepper used to cast this spell and unleash an excruciating spray of caustic fluid. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d10} acid damage on a failed save and is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}.
A creature with resistance or immunity to fire damage is not {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}, even if it fails its saving throw.

m.text: a spicy pepper, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conceal the Dying
entries: Choose an {@condition unconscious} creature with 0 hit points that you can see within range. That creature becomes {@condition invisible} for the spell's duration, and teleports to an unoccupied space within 15 feet of it. You cannot choose a point that would cause the target to take damage, such as a pool of lava or the {@spell wall of fire} spell.

spell.name: Conjure Courtesan
entries: You utter a lustful incantation a call forth a lascivious dark-winged fiend of pleasure. It takes the form of a {@creature succubus} or incubus, as you choose.

The fiend is outwardly friendly to you and your companions, but may attempt to bewitch or seduce any of you, as it would were it free. It cannot inflict the {@condition charmed} condition on you, but can on other creatures.

As part of casting the spell, you issue a command to the fiend. The fiend will refuse if ordered to participate in direct combat, but will take the form of any person requested and perform other tasks, such as seducing a guard or noble, providing pleasure to a creature you choose, or gathering information while in disguise.

When the spell ends, the fiend telepathically reports the results of its task to you, ignoring the range limits of its telepathy as described in its Telepathic Bond feature. It then vanishes in a puff of perfumed smoke.

m.text: a crystal vial worth at least 100 gp filled with seminal fluid, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot level of 4th level or higher, you summon an additional fiend for every two slot levels above 3rd. You can issue a separate command to each conjured fiend.

spell.name: Crocodile Tears
entries: A torrent of artificial sorrow bursts from your eyes, forcing each creature in a 30-foot cone to make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Each of the below conditions you are suffering lends credibility to your outburst, allowing the tears to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the listed type:

You can add as many additional dice as you have conditions, but the same condition from multiple sources only applies a single damage die. After the spell ends, you can end one of the listed conditions on yourself.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the acid damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Crucify
entries: You conjure a lance of energy in an empty hand, which pierces your enemies' very souls with divine wrath. You can use a bonus action to hurl the lance at a creature within range. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. If you miss, the lance teleports back to you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d8} radiant damage if your deity is good, {@damage 7d8} force damage if it is neutral, or {@damage 7d8} necrotic damage if it is evil. The target must then make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the target is {@condition restrained} against a crucifix of light until you conjure and throw another lance as a bonus action, restraining a new target. While {@condition restrained} in this way, a target is vulnerable to all damage.
At the start of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. The spell ends if the target dies.

m.text: a spear of solid gold worth at least 2,000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Damnation

time.condition: which you take when a fiend or humanoid of evil alignment within range that you can see dies

entries: With an oath of condemnation, you damn the soul of the dying target to eternal torment. The symbol of a fiend appropriate to punish the soul for its sins (or the fiend whose symbol you are using, if you chose that material component) appears as a brand on the target's forehead or anatomical equivalent, where it remains for the next 10 years.

While the brand remains, spells such as {@spell raise dead} that would restore the target to life, or spells such as {@spell sending} or {@spell speak with dead} that could communicate with its soul automatically fails, and any effect that would return it from Hell, such as the gate or plane shift spells, automatically fails. If a creature attempts to cast such a spell upon the target, its soul, or its corpse, it takes {@damage 8d10} psychic damage.

m.text: an amulet dedicated to a god or fiend worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the brand's lasts an additional 10 years for each slot level above 5th.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you can also target a humanoid of any alignment, or a celestial. In addition, you can target a living creature with this spell; the brand appears on the target's forehead and applies its effects after the target dies.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a chunk of brimstone worth at least 10,000 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Demolishing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon roars with hurricane force. The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} thunder damage to the target, which is {@condition deafened} until the spell ends.

If you hit an object with a melee weapon attack while {@status concentration||concentrating} on this spell (before or after you hit a creature), the object crumbles under your wrath and takes an extra {@dice 8d6} thunder damage from the attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Disfigure
entries: You reach out with a free hand dripping with caustic acid and make a melee spell attack against a creature within reach. On a hit, you grab its face and the target takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage and is {@condition grappled}, so long as it is of a size that you can grapple normally. If the target is too large for you to grapple, the spell ends.

At the start of each of its turns, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice) to attempt to escape, ending the spell on a success.

If you hold the creature's face for the spell's duration and it survives, its face is horrifically scarred and mutilated for 1 year. A creature that sees its face must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against fear or take {@dice 1d4} nonlethal psychic damage. The {@spell lesser restoration} spell or similar magic immediately ends this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Disorienting Drone
entries: You release an obnoxious buzz from within your lungs that rattles creatures within range. Each creature within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} thunder damage.
Until the spell ends, creatures other than you within the spell's range have disadvantage on saving throws to maintain {@status concentration} on spells.

The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and its radius increases by 5 feet when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}, 20 feet), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}, 25 feet), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}, 30 feet).

spell.name: Distill Spirits
entries: You touch the corpse of a creature that died within the last 10 minutes and bottle its life force in the container used to cast this spell, which fills with luminescent fluid that sheds dim light in a 1-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the liquid functions as a {@item potion of healing}, and becomes inert if removed from the container and not drunk immediately (including if you use the container to cast the spell again). The potion becomes inert when the spell ends.

The strength of the creature you target with the spell determines the potion's potency. A creature with a challenge rating of 5 or higher produces a {@item potion of greater healing}, a creature with a challenge rating of 10 or higher produces a {@item potion of superior healing}, and a creature with a challenge rating of 15 or higher produces a {@item potion of supreme healing}.

m.text: a watertight glass container worth at least 25 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 2nd-level or higher, the hit points restored by the potion increases by {@dice 2d4} for every slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dying Curse

time.condition: which you take when you are reduced      to 0 hit points

entries: With your last breath before falling {@condition unconscious}, you utter a foul curse against the creature that slew you, which must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage. Whether the target succeeds or fails, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the result when it makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, the spell's duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a slot of 4th level or higher, its duration increases to 24 hours, and when you use a slot of 5th level or higher, its duration increases to 7 days.

spell.name: Eclipse
entries: Your magic darkens the light of the sun and moon, thinning the boundaries between worlds and allowing evil to flourish. For the duration, all bright light within range is reduced to dim light, all dim lights are extinguished, the radius of all lights is halved, and any spell that creates light is dispelled immediately upon casting, with no effect. In addition, all surfaces within the spell's area that are not already hallowed ground become desecrated ground (as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide).

In addition, the eclipse empowers types of creatures you choose when you cast this spell. Choose one or more of the following types of creatures: aberrations, fey, fiends, monstrosities, and undead. When cast within the spell's area, spells to animate, conjure, create, resurrect, or summon the chosen creature types do not require material components, including those with a cost measured in gold pieces, and take half as long to cast. If such a spell has a casting time of 1 action, it becomes 1 bonus action instead.

Creatures within the spell's area have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other effects inflicted by creatures of the chosen type, and creatures of the chosen type have advantage on attack rolls against creatures of other types while inside.
Finally, you and other creatures that you choose are considered one of the types of creature listed above until the spell ends, even if you leave the spell's area.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration changes to "Until Dispelled." In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires the freshly-slain corpse of a good-aligned humanoid or celestial, which the spell consumes.

m.text: a ruby pendant carved in the shape of a humanoid face worth at least 15,000 gp

spell.name: Entropic Shield

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile} spell

entries: A translucent black barrier of magically-accelerated time appears around you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

Until the spell ends, if a melee weapon attack misses you, the weapon is destroyed so long as it is not a natural or magical weapon, which instead takes a -5 penalty to attack and damage rolls until the next dawn. If a ranged weapon attack misses you, the ammunition is destroyed.

spell.name: Eternal Melody
entries: You pour your soul into a haunting, unforgettable tune that takes root in the minds of humanoids that can hear you within range. Each target must make a Charisma saving throw. Choose one target that failed its saving throw to become cursed by you. The song plays incessantly at the back of its mind, subtly influencing its mood and behavior. A {@spell remove curse} spell cast at 5th level or higher, or similar magic, can quiet the melody and end the spell. If you target another creature with this spell, the spell ends. Over the next 120 days, the creature's attitudes and beliefs become similar to yours. Its speech patterns, personal style, religious and moral beliefs, and interests trend towards yours and away from its own, within the limits of its means.

If you die after the 120 days pass, then the melody intensifies and your soul enters the target's body, allowing you to possess it. You retain your personality, memories, and abilities (including your ability scores, proficiencies, and class features), and gain the target's memories (but not their features and traits) as you assimilate their consciousness into yours. Your original physical remains, if they exist, can't be restored to life, since your soul is elsewhere.

m.text: a musical instrument worth at least 10,000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: False Betrayal
entries: With a desperate and heartfelt plea, you attempt to convince each hostile creature within 60 feet of you that you are friendly to it. The exact nature of this alliance varies with the target; they might believe that you are an ally to its master or commander, a double agent planted by the faction to which they belong, or have become convinced to switch sides.

Each creature within range that can hear you, including your allies, must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target believes your words to be true, and regards you as an enemy or an ally, as appropriate. Formerly friendly creatures react to your perceived betrayal in accordance with their typical behavior, and may attack you.
Targets return to their senses after the spell ends, and are aware that you deceived them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, you can maintain {@status concentration} on the spell for up to an hour. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours.

spell.name: Fever
entries: You inflict a supernatural pyrexia upon a creature you touch, which must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Whether the target succeeds or fails, it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, gaining an additional level of {@condition exhaustion} after each failed saving throw. If the target succeeds on three saving throws against this spell or survives until 7 days pass, the spell ends and it can recover from {@condition exhaustion} as normal.
This magical illness ignores immunity to disease, but can still be cured by spells that cure disease such as {@spell lesser restoration}.

spell.name: Finale
entries: In an act of desperation, you release bottled reserves of magic in a climactic blast. Each creature within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

If you have no remaining spell slots of 5th level or lower and no class features or magic items (such as the Arcane Recovery feature or sorcery points) to restore them, then you roll {@damage 12d10} force damage instead.

spell.name: Flood
entries: You call forth waters from above and beneath the earth in a 1-mile radius circle centered on a point you can see within range. If at least part of the circle is outdoors, then storm clouds coalesce and pour rain on the circle for the duration of the spell, creating heavy precipitation within the spell's area.

The water levels of any bodies of water within the area, such as wells, streams, lakes, and rivers within the circle rise by 1 foot for every hour that passes. While the water rises and after the spell ends, the water drains as natural water would, taking the path of least resistance as it follows the flow of gravity. Creatures that enter the water for the first time or start their turn there must make a Strength saving throw or be swept 60 feet downstream. Creatures with a swimming speed have advantage on this saving throw. On a success, the target can swim as it normally would during its turn; most creatures will attempt to reach dry land.

A Large or larger object that is not being worn or carried and any structure caught in the flood takes 10 damage for every hour at least half of its height is submerged in the water as the water flows. This damage may destroy the lower parts of the structure and cause the building to collapse, including upper sections that are above the rising water.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration increases to 7 days. In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a model boat made of cedar and pitch and an opal worth at least 10,000 gp, both of which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Force Martyrdom

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack

entries: You speak a prayer beseeching the divine for aid, which a believer that can hear you within range immediately answers. Choose a creature other than the attacker that can see and hear you within range. A willing target or a target that fails a Wisdom saving throw moves toward you if its speed will bring you to a point within 5 feet of you, and becomes the target of the attack. The spell fails and has no effect if the target can't reach you or would end its movement behind full cover that would prevent the attack from hitting it.
The attack automatically hits the target, regardless of its armor class, and if the attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the attacker takes {@damage 2d12} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Grand Finale
entries: An explosion of your final reserves of magic tears from your body in a climactic finishing stroke. Each creature within 120 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 20d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

If you have no spell slots of 8th level or lower remaining (or abilities such as Mystic Arcanum that grant spell slots of the same level) and no class features or magic items to restore them (such as the Arcane Recovery feature or sorcery points), then you deal {@damage 45d10} force damage instead.

spell.name: Hemorrhage

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range takes bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, or psychic damage

entries: You magically shred the exposed blood vessels of the wounded target, which takes necrotic damage equal to the triggering damage. A creature that does not bleed, such as most oozes and constructs, takes no damage from this spell.

m.text: a rusty scalpel, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a slot of 3rd level or higher, you deal an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Improved Contagion
entries: Your touch inflicts disease. When you cast this spell, and as an action until your {@status concentration} ends, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach to infect it.

On a hit, you can no longer spread disease, and the target is {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, it is no longer {@condition poisoned}, and the spell ends. If the target fails three saves, the target is no longer {@condition poisoned}, but choose one of the diseases below for the next 7 days.

Until you stop {@status concentration||concentrating} on the spell, you can repeat the melee spell attack against the target, causing it to take {@dice 6d6} poison damage and automatically fail its next Constition saving throw against this spell.

Since this spell induces an unnatural disease in its target, any effect that removes a disease must have enough power to remove it, such as the {@spell lesser restoration} or {@spell dispel magic} spell cast at 5th level or higher. It also ignores immunity to nonmagical disease.

entries.name: Blinding Sickness
entries: Pain grips the creature's mind, and its eyes turn milky white. The creature has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws and is {@condition blinded}.

entries.name: Filth Fever
entries: A raging fever sweeps through the creature's body. The creature has disadvantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and attack rolls that use Strength.

entries.name: Flesh Rot
entries: The creature's flesh decays. The creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks and vulnerability to all damage.

entries.name: Mindfire
entries: The creature's mind becomes feverish. The creature has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws, and the creature behaves as if under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell during combat.

entries.name: Seizure
entries: The creature is overcome with shaking. The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks, Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls that use Dexterity.

entries.name: Slimy Doom
entries: The creature begins to bleed uncontrollably. The creature has disadvantage on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws. In addition, whenever the creature takes damage, it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Induce Defecation
entries: You reach into the mind of a creature you can see within range and attempt to trigger an instinctive bowel release. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a clothed target has its speed reduced by 10 feet and has disadvantage on all Charisma checks until it changes its clothes and bathes. Damage to its reputation may be long-lasting or even permanent.

Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the target must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, it is immune to the effects of this spell for the next 24 hours.
Creatures that do not need to eat or feel no shame about sudden defecation (such as most beasts) automatically succeed on saving throws against this spell.

spell.name: Indulgence
entries: You allow a creature you touch to purchase moral salvation. The target's alignment becomes Good, rather than Neutral or Evil. Its personality, and place on the axis of Law and Chaos, remains unchanged.
This change to its alignment is permanent until it commits sufficiently evil acts to change its alignment to Neutral or Evil. The target's personality and desires are unchanged.

m.text: treasure, art objects, or gemstones worth      at least 1,000 gp belonging to the target, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Infection

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range takes bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, or      fire damage

entries: You conjure a plague and inject it into the target's wounds, forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is afflicted with one of the following diseases of your choice: {@condition filth fever}, {@condition flesh rot}, {@condition seizure}, {@condition sewer plague|dmg}, or {@condition sight rot|dmg}. As a magical disease, a sickness inflicted by this spell ignores immunity to disease. Any effect that removes a disease must have enough power to remove it, such as the {@spell lesser restoration} or {@spell dispel magic} spell cast at 2nd level or higher.

m.text: a soiled cloth, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the level of the spell slot required to remove the disease increases by 1 for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Intensify Emotions
entries: You attempt to dredge up strong emotions within the minds of creatures within range. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.
You can enhance any effect causing a target to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. Its duration is doubled, and any creature suffering it has disadvantage on saving throws against it.

Alternatively, you can make a target feel passionately about creatures or concepts you choose. This passion may cause it to become hostile to other creatures, undergo intense depression, or experience other strong emotions based on its current situation, as determined by the DM.
When the spell ends, the targets become calm again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

spell.name: Invert Restoration

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range regains hit points

entries: Rather than regain hit points, the target takes necrotic damage equal to the amount of hit points it would have regained.

m.text: a {@item potion of poison|dmg} worth at least 50 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, its duration increases to {@status concentration}, up to 1 minute, and applies to all sources of healing the target receives during that time. At 4th level, its duration increases to {@status concentration}, up to 10 minutes, and at 5th level, its duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Ironskin
entries: Fluid, ferrous metal coats the flesh of a willing creature you touch. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and gains a +2 bonus to its AC. When the target is struck by a weapon made from metal, the wielder is disarmed as the weapon sticks to the target's skin.

m.text: a metal shard and diamond dust worth at least 250 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Locusts on the Wind
entries: A dense swarm of frenzied locusts fills a 100-foot radius sphere centered upon a point you can see within range, which lasts for the duration. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The swarm has 300 hit points, and can only be damaged by effects that target an area. If the swarm is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

When a creature or an object made of plant materials enters the spell's area or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 14d4} piercing damage. Plants and objects made from plants take the maximum possible damage from this spell.

The swarm moves 15 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. You can use your action to change the swarm's direction, and it moves at the same speed in the new direction until instructed otherwise, or the spell ends.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you can center the swarm on any point that you can see, its duration increases to 24 hours, and its radius increases to 1 mile. In addition, any plant with a challenge rating lower than 10, or that does not have a monster's statistics, is destroyed when the swarm fully envelops it. In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning a bushel of wheat and an onyx statue of a grasshopper worth at least 500 gp, both of which the spell consumes.

m.text: a bag of desert sand, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4}.

spell.name: Man of Straw
entries: You conjure a Medium image of a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, which appears at a point within range as a crude, mocking caricature. The caricature has AC 10 and 100 hit points. When a creature hits the caricature with an attack, the target takes the same amount of damage, but does not suffer any other effects. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. The caricature takes damage from effects that require a saving throw, but does not transfer any other effects.
When the target takes damage from the caricature, it can make a Charisma saving throw. The spell ends if it succeeds or the caricature is reduced to 0 hit points.

m.text: a pyrite crystal worth at least 250 gp, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the caricature's hit points increase by 25 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Malignant Brand
entries: You charge a free hand or the material component with accursed energy, allowing you to mark a target as a wretched creature cursed by black magic.

The next time you hit a creature with a melee spell attack (which you can take as part of the action used to cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn), the target takes {@damage 2d12} necrotic damage and is cursed by you until the spell ends as a scar appears on its body. The brand cannot be larger than your hand, and you cannot write more than a single word, but the brand otherwise takes an appearance you choose, often the symbol on the branding iron or your spellcasting focus. Once you brand a creature, you can't brand another until the spell ends.

Until the spell ends, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage whenever you hit it with an attack. If you target a beast, celestial, fey, or humanoid with this spell, you deal an additional {@damage 1d12} damage instead.

If you concentrate on the spell for its full duration, the spell no longer grants bonus damage, and the brand is permanently burned into the target's body. It cannot be removed by any means short of the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of the initial spell attack damage increases by {@dice 1d12}.

spell.name: Miasma
entries: You touch the corpse of a creature that died no more than 1 month ago, which putrefies over the duration of the spell. Colorless, odorless gas imperceptible to nonmagical senses rises from the corpse in a 60-foot-radius, 120-foot-high cylinder centered on it that sickens all who approach.
When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw against disease. On a success, it suffers no ill effects.
After the spell ends, each creature that failed its saving throw takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage and {@damage 3d8} poison damage.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, each creature killed by damage from this spell emanates the same cloud of gas, creatures killed by that cloud of gas emanate their own, and so on.
