In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a sealed crystal vial worth at least 5,000 gp filled with a mixture of blood from an {@creature ancient green dragon} and the milk of a {@creature marilith}, which the spell consumes.

m.text: a corpse, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both the necrotic and poison damage increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Obsession
entries: You ignite the passions of a creature whose true name you know, and direct them toward a particular

individual, which becomes the subject of the spell. When you cast this spell, the target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, choose one of the passions below, which it directs toward the subject.

At the end of every 7 days, the target makes another saving throw against this spell. On a failed save, its behavior intensifies as detailed below. After three successes, the spell ends. After three failures, the spell becomes permanent and cannot be removed by any means short of a remove curse spell cast at 9th level, or similar magic. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target accumulates three of a kind. A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeeds on saving throws against this spell.

A kiss from the target's true love, if it has one, immediately ends the spell on the target. The DM is the ultimate arbiter of the target's true love, though this spell cannot make the subject into the target's true love if it wasn't already.

entries.name: Admiration
entries: The target grows slavishly reverent toward the subject, taking every opportunity to compliment even if it is not present or relevant. After one failed save, the target takes pains to agree with the subject's opinions and decisions, regarding them as superior to its own. After two failed saves, it avoids social obligations and other responsibilities, preferring to spend time at the subject's side and growing irritable and uncooperative when separated. After three failed saves, the target makes no further saving throws against this spell and is incensed to violence any time the subject is contradicted or threatened. It also obeys the subject's every whim, even unto death. If the subject dies or rejects the target, the target falls into a depression that fades after a number of years equal to your spellcasting ability score.

entries.name: Envy
entries: The target grows bitterly jealous of the subject, taking every opportunity to unfavorably compare its own life to that of the subject's, and implies those fortunes were gained unfairly or unlawfully. After one failed save, the target disregards any assets or benefits it possesses that the subject does not, and bends every means it has toward obtaining items, companions, or positions comparable to those owned by the subject. After two failed saves, the target's envy crystallizes and it begs, borrows, or steals the objects of desire directly from the subject. After three failed saves, the target makes no further saving throws against this spell, and devotes every resource to taking all the subject possesses. Once it leaves the subject with nothing, the target becomes obsessed with hidden treasures or secrets it believes the subject kept, and ignores all other material pursuits until it locates the imagined loot. This desperate pursuit fades after a number of years equal to your spellcasting ability score.

entries.name: Hatred
entries: The target considers the subject a mortal enemy, regardless of previous affections the two shared. After one failed save, the target becomes short-tempered and cruel in the presence of the subject, hurling spiteful insults at it whenever the two are together. After two failed saves, it spends every effort to subtly or underhandedly ruin the subject, such as abusing its authority to arrest or seize the subject, hiring thieves to steal its possessions, or spreading libelous rumors. After three failed saves, the target makes no further saving throws against this spell, and either gathers allies to assassinate the subject or attempts to kill it directly. After the subject's death, the target devotes its energies to grinding the memories and legacy of the subject to nothing, disregarding all other obligations for a number of years equal to your spellcasting ability score.

entries.name: Lust
entries: The target deeply desires the subject, disregarding all previous romantic relationships and even familial bonds in favor of this new passion. After one failed save, the target finds everything about the subject attractive and alluring, and ravenously seeks new information about it and its habits. After two failed saves, the target devotes every effort to courting the subject, whether or not the subject reciprocates those affections.
The target takes rejection poorly, often reacting with thunderous temper before returning with pricier gifts, more elaborate stanzas of poetic adoration, and similar affectations.

After three failed saves, the target makes no further saving throws against this spell and attempts to abduct, imprison, or otherwise isolate the subject from others that might compete for the target's affections, whether or not its feelings are reciprocated. If the subject dies or otherwise leaves the target's reach, the target becomes depressed and may fall into other vices for a number of years equal to your spellcasting ability score, or attempt suicide.

entries.name: Vengeance
entries: The target nurses a grudge born from a real or imagined slight and becomes wholly obsessed with enacting justice. After one failed save, the target becomes wary of the subject, avoiding its presence whenever possible in fear that its plans might be detected. After two failed saves, the target uses whatever underhanded means available to it to learn the subject's patterns, preferences, and weaknesses, in order to best destroy it.

After three failed saves, the target no longer makes saves against this spell, and pursues the subject with single-minded violent intent with no regard to its own safety until either or both are dead. After the subject dies, the target listlessly seeks a new goal, but fails to do so and finds life hollow and unfulfilling for a number of years equal to your spellcasting ability score.

m.text: a lock of hair or drop of blood from the subject and target of this spell and a locket worth at least 500 gp, all of which the spell consumes

spell.name: Omen
entries: You speak with a creature throughout the casting time of the spell, reading its fortune. You can predict anything you wish, but must include an event, creature, location, or situation, which fills the target with unspeakable dread. Examples include the target's spouse, a rout of troops under its command, or deep water.

The target does everything possible to avoid the subject, but may be forced by circumstance to approach it. At the end of each hour it can see the subject, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. You know when the target makes the save, and can deal {@damage 5d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

For every week that passes, the target can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, spell ends, but a less intense feeling of dread may remain permanently. Creatures with advantage on saving throws against fear or are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition have advantage on saving throws against this spell.

components.m: a divining device such as a crystal ball, a bowl of water, a fire, or carved knucklebones

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the interval between saving throws increases to 1 month. When you use a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, the interval increases to 1 year. At 8th level, the interval increases to 5 years, and at 9th level, the target cannot make Wisdom saving throws to end the effect. In addition, when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for every slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Piercing Roots
entries: Gnarled roots tear from the ground and stab into the flesh of a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} piercing damage and become {@condition restrained} until the spell ends. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can also choose to target a Large or larger object or structure with this spell, which take an additional {@damage 2d8} piercing damage at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. Objects and structures that cannot move automatically fail saving throws against this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Plowshare to Sword
entries: You touch a nonmagical object that is not being worn or carried, and is not already a weapon, and transform it into a nonmagical weapon made of similar material and of roughly the same size. For example, you could turn a platter into a dagger, a rake into a spear, a rope into a whip, or a crowbar into a shortsword.

You are proficient in the weapon if you aren't already, and lose that proficiency when the weapon is destroyed. The weapon crumbles to dust if it is ever more than 15 feet from you or you cast this spell again.

components.m: a sliver of iron or steel

spell.name: Regress
entries: After spending the casting time cutting away magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller humanoid or beast. The target must have an Intelligence score of 4 or greater. The target's Intelligence is reduced to 3, and it loses the ability to speak or read any language, though it still understands spoken words in one language you know.

The regressed creature is {@condition charmed} by you for 30 days or until you and your companions do anything harmful to it. After the {@condition charmed} condition ends, it remains loyal to you and follows your commands.

m.text: a jasper worth at least 10,000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Righteous Brand
entries: You charge a free hand or the material component with accusatory energy, allowing you to mark a target as a wretched sinner. The next time you hit a creature with a melee spell attack (which you can take as part of the action used to cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn), the target takes {@damage 2d12} radiant damage, and it is cursed by you. The curse manifests as a brand burned into its skin on the point you touched it. The brand cannot be larger than your hand, and you cannot write more than a single word or character, but otherwise takes on an appearance you choose, often the symbol on the branding iron or your spellcasting focus. Once you brand a creature, you can't brand another until the spell ends.

Until the spell ends, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage whenever you hit it with an attack. If you target a fey, fiend, humanoid, or undead with this spell, you deal an additional {@damage 1d12} damage instead.

If you concentrate on the spell for its full duration, the spell no longer grants bonus damage, the brand is permanently burned into the target's body. It cannot be removed by any means short of the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of the initial spell attack damage increases by {@dice 1d12}.

spell.name: Riot
entries: You speak an inciting incantation that provokes mindless anger in those that hear it. Each creature in a 60-foot cube within range that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target is {@condition charmed} by you for the duration of the spell.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, a target is filled with hateful, murderous rage. It is {@condition deafened}, and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, and fire damage. It must use its action each turn moving toward and attacking the creature, object, or structure closest to it, ignoring you and other creatures that are {@condition charmed} by you. If it cannot move to attack a creature and cannot make a ranged attack (including picking up items to throw), it takes the Dash action to close the distance between it and its target or does whatever necessary to evade, destroy, or break free of any obstacles. It avoids obvious hazards such as spikes and pits of acid, but will endure damage to reach a target if it has no other alternatives.

When a {@condition charmed} creature ends its turn without attacking another creature or taking damage since the start of its last turn, it can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the spell ends against the target.

When you cast this spell, you can specify a race, lineage, cultural unit such as a religion or political ideology, or other group to become the target of the crowd's ire. Rather than undirected destruction, creatures {@condition charmed} by this spell seek out members of the group and objects and structures associated with them to the best of their knowledge.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration becomes Instantaneous, and any creature that sees a creature charmed by you other than those designated during casting (if any) must make a saving throw against the spell. In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires an intricate source of flame, such as a jeweled brazier or a gilded torch worth at least 250 gp, which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the spell's duration increases to 8 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, its duration increases to 24 hours, and if you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, its duration increases to 7 days.

spell.name: Rouse Graveyard
entries: You can only cast this spell between midnight and dawn. Every corpse of a Small or Medium humanoid within the spell's area that still has flesh rises as a {@creature zombie} (the DM has the statistics for these creatures).

Undead that you create with this spell will not attack you, or other creatures that you specify while you cast the spell. Those other creatures can be named, or match a general description such as those belonging to a certain race, wearing a certain uniform, or residing in a certain area. The undead are otherwise not under your control, and will not follow your orders.

A Small or Medium humanoid killed by an undead created by this spell is animated as a {@creature zombie} 1 minute after its death. That {@creature zombie} is also considered a {@creature zombie} created by this spell. If another creature begins casting {@spell gentle repose} or a spell that returns the dead to life, such as {@spell revivify}, the corpse's reanimation is delayed until the casting is interrupted or completed (which prevents the corpse from becoming a {@creature zombie} and instead returns it to life).

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its area increases to a 1-mile cube. Each reanimated corpse uses the statistics of a ghoul, rather than a zombie. The spell also summons 1d10 mummies, 1d8 banshees, and 1d4 beholder zombies. In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a black diamond carved into the shape of a human skull worth at least 10,000 gp and a living necromancer or cleric, both of which the spell consumes.

m.text: a bundle of pufferfish spines, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Rupture
entries: You charge a free hand with vibrations that rip through living tissue. The next time you hit a creature with a melee spell attack, you rupture one of its vital organs and cannot make this attack again. The target takes {@damage 10d6} acid damage, and must expend 2 feet of movement for every foot it moves until the spell ends.
Creatures without organs, such as most oozes and incorporeal undead, take no damage from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sear
entries: You cause a source of light within range, such as a lantern or torch, to blaze with the intensity of the sun. Each creature within 15 feet of the light source must make a Constitution saving throw as it is bathed in natural sunlight. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage and is burned, becoming vulnerable to fire and radiant damage until it takes a long rest or the burn is removed. A lesser restoration spell or similar magic can remove the burn. On a success, a target takes half as much radiant damage and is not burned.
The light source continues to emanate natural sunlight for the next minute.

Creatures wearing medium or heavy armor, clad in heavy clothing, or with little or no protection against the sun (such as creatures wearing no clothing, or with no fur) have disadvantage on saving throws against this spell. Creatures with resistance or immunity to fire damage or are naturally adapted to hot climates, automatically succeed on saving throws against this spell.
Whether a target succeeds or fails, it must take a drink of water within the next hour or suffer {@dice 1d4} levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
If you cast this spell while outdoors during a sunny day, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 4d6}.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration increases to Concentration, up to 8 hours, its range increases to 5 miles and the area it targets changes to a 1-mile-radius, 1-mile-high cylinder that must appear at least half a mile above the surface of the ground or water beneath it, where the orb of light appears. The spell's area inflicts {@hazard extreme heat|dmg} and is filled with bright light, which is natural sunlight. Creatures within the area are vulnerable to radiant and fire damage.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires three {@item sun blade|dmg|sun blades}, which the spell consumes.

m.text: a magnifying glass worth at least 5 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sear
entries: You cause a source of light within range, such as a lantern or torch, to blaze with the intensity of the sun. Each creature within 15 feet of the light source must make a Constitution saving throw as it is bathed in natural sunlight. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage and is burned, becoming vulnerable to fire and radiant damage until it takes a long rest or the burn is removed. A {@spell lesser restoration} spell or similar magic can remove the burn. On a success, a target takes half as much radiant damage and is not burned.
The light source continues to emanate natural sunlight for the next minute.

Creatures wearing medium or heavy armor, clad in heavy clothing, or with little or no protection against the sun (such as creatures wearing no clothing, or with no fur) have disadvantage on saving throws against this spell. Creatures with resistance or immunity to fire damage or are naturally adapted to hot climates, automatically succeed on saving throws against this spell.
Whether a target succeeds or fails, it must take a drink of water within the next hour or suffer {@dice 1d4} levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
If you cast this spell while outdoors during a sunny day, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 4d6}.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration increases to Concentration, up to 8 hours, its range increases to 5 miles and the area it targets changes to a 1-mile-radius, 1-mile-high cylinder that must appear at least half a mile above the surface of the ground or water beneath it, where the orb of light appears. The spell's area inflicts extreme heat and is filled with bright light, which is natural sunlight. Creatures within the area are vulnerable to radiant and fire damage.

m.text: a magnifying glass worth at least 5 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Suicide Bomber
entries: You spend the spell's casting time deep in conversation with a creature in an attempt to convince it to lay down its life for a greater cause. At the end of the conversation, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends. A creature that trusts you and your authority or convictions has disadvantage on this saving throw. On a success, the conversation continues as normal, but the spell ends, the spell slot is consumed and the target will act in accordance with its wishes after the conversation ends.

As part of casting the spell, you describe a particular location. It can be a specific place, such as a certain square in one district of a city, or a general description of one, such as a temple dedicated to a specific deity.

If it fails the saving throw and it is able, the target takes the first opportunity to journey to a described location. Once there, the target waits for the opportunity to deal as much death and destruction as it can conceive of within the next 24 hours. Magic then converts its body to energy, which explodes.
All creatures and objects within a 100-foot-radius sphere take {@damage 8d10} force damage. The target's body is eradicated, and the target cannot be resurrected by any means short of a wish spell.

If a structure is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures that survive the initial blast. A creature within a damaged structure or within half a distance equal to half its height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become buried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the initial explosion's damage increases by {@dice 2d10}.

spell.name: Terminal Velocity

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range takes damage from falling

entries: You amplify the target's weight, accelerating it toward the ground at devastating speed. The number of damage dice the target rolls determined by the height it fell doubles (up to {@dice 40d6}), and the damage roll uses the highest possible result on each die, rather than rolling.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, you can target an additional creature for every slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Tenser's Destructive Disk
entries: This spell creates a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3 feet in diameter and with an infinitely thin thickness, that floats just beside your hand before you hurl it at creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d10} slashing damage, and the spell ends.

If the attack misses, then the disk returns to a space next to you, where it hovers near you for 1 hour and moves with you as described in the {@spell Tenser's floating disk} spell. You can use your action on subsequent turns to throw the disk again.

If you cast this spell while one or more Tenser's floating disk follow you, then you can cast this spell with a spell slot of 1st-level or higher, rather than 3rd. The disk deposits its contents in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you before you throw it, and returns to that space and scoops up the carried objects if it misses. If it hits, both this spell and Tenser's floating disk end.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slow of 4th -level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: True Faith
entries: A 10-foot radius {@condition invisible} sphere filled with unshakeable conviction surrounds you, denying all heresy. This sphere has all the same effects of the 8th-level {@spell antimagic field} spell, but has no effect on creatures, spells, magical items, and other effects created by an artifact, deity, cleric, paladin, or other divine spellcaster affiliated with your god or philosophy, including you.
Other artifacts and effects created by other deities are suppressed within the sphere.

m.text: a holy symbol worth at least 1000 gp

spell.name: Wall of Skin
entries: You cut through the air and force a creature you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 6d8} slashing damage. On a failed save, the target's skin peels from its body and is splayed in a wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 inch thick. If the wall is not anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees), the wall collapses and the spell ends.
The wall has AC 10, and half of the damage the wall takes is applied to the target. The target is {@condition restrained} until the spell ends.
When the spell ends, the wall collapses, and the creature's skin flows back onto its body at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Wine to Water
entries: You touch a container with a capacity of 50 gallons or less. If the container holds alcoholic beverages, such as beer, wine, mead, or liquor, it is converted to water. If the beverage is polluted, {@condition poisoned}, or otherwise contaminated, the water remains equally unsafe to drink.

spell.name: Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting (reckoning)
entries: You draw the moisture from every creature in a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. Constructs and undead aren't affected, and plants and water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. A creature takes {@damage 12d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Nonmagical plants in the area that aren't creatures, such as trees and shrubs, wither and die instantly.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's range increases to "Sight," and its area increases to a 10-mile radius. Any nonmagical plant within the spell's area that withers and dies blights the land around it; no nonmagical plant can grow in its space for 100 years.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a scythe made of black onyx and a mummy's bones worth at least 10,000 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Air Bubble (reckoning)
entries: You create a spectral globe around the head of a willing creature you can see within range. The globe is filled with fresh air that lasts until the spell ends. If the creature has more than one head, the globe of air appears around only one of its heads (which is all the creature needs to avoid suffocation, assuming that all its heads share the same respiratory system).

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's range changes to Self (120-foot radius) and the air bubble swells to fill the entire area. The bubble is lighter than air, rising at a rate of 60 feet per minute (10 feet per round), and lifts all Huge and smaller creatures and objects inside it, which slide to its bottom. The bubble has 1 hit point, a Damage Threshold of 50, and is immune to all damage besides piercing and slashing.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a living {vapor slop|AbiDalzims} which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can create two additional globes of fresh air for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Bones of the Earth (reckoning)
entries: You cause up to six pillars of stone to burst from places on the ground that you can see within range. Each pillar is a cylinder that has a diameter of 5 feet and a height of up to 30 feet. The ground where a pillar appears must be wide enough for its diameter, and you can target the ground under a creature if that creature is Medium or smaller. Each pillar has AC 5 and 30 hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points, a pillar crumbles into rubble, which creates an area of {@quickref difficult terrain||3} with a 10-foot radius that lasts until the rubble is cleared. Each 5-foot-diameter portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
If a pillar is created under a creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be lifted by the pillar. A creature can choose to fail the save.

If a pillar is prevented from reaching its full height because of a ceiling or other obstacle, a creature on the pillar takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained}, pinched between the pillar and the obstacle. The {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (the creature's choice) against the spell's save DC. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and must either move off the pillar or fall off it.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's range increases to "Sight" and you can create any number of pillars. The pillars can have a height of up to 1 mile and a width of up to 500 feet, and have 10,000 hit points each. You can shape the interior and exterior into simple shapes, such as cliffs, internal caves, buildings, and statues, but can't create vehicles, intricate masonry, or other objects that require a require a high degree of craftsmanship unless you have proficiency with the type of artisan's tools used to craft such objects.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a pickaxe carved from the spines of a {@creature tarrasque}, which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can create two additional pillars for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Calm Emotions (reckoning)
entries: You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.

You can suppress any effect causing a target to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to "Sight," and its area increases to a 1-mile-radius sphere. You can choose a hostile attitude or belief toward a group of people, a place, or a concept, and remove it from the minds of each target that fails its saving throw.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires bottles of {@item Fine Wine (bottle)|PHB| fine wine} worth 25,000 gp in total, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Conjure Cannon (reckoning)
entries: You summon a heavy bronze bombard at a point you can see within range, which instantly aims and fires a cannonball in a direction of your choice. The ball flies in a straight line up to 150 feet before falling to the ground. If the ball would impact a creature or object, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the ball strikes the target, which takes {@damage 8d8} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a structure or construct, the damage it takes is doubled.
If the cannonball kills or destroys the target, it continues flying along its path. Otherwise, the ball stops moving.

Until the spell ends, iron cannonballs and gunpowder magically appear in a space of your choice within 5 feet of the cannon, which can be used to load and fire the cannon, following the normal rules for siege engines. These supplies disappear if moved more than 5 feet away from the cannon or used for any other purpose, and do not explode upon taking fire or lightning damage. Both the cannon and any conjured supplies left on the battlefield disappear when this spell ends.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the range of the cannons summoned increases to 2,000 feet, the spell's duration increases to 24 hours, and it summons a number of cannons equal to the total level of slots expended to cast the spell as a reckoning within 150 feet of the caster. One cannon fires each minute unless you stop the cannons from firing. The cannons automatically reload themselves, and you can fire any number of loaded cannons as an action.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a pair of strong magnets and a slug of adamantine worth at least 3,500 gp, which the spell consumes.

components.m: a lead ball and a pinch of gunpowder

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Control Water (reckoning)

components.m: a drop of water and a pinch of dust

entries: Until the spell ends, you control any freestanding water inside an area you choose that is a cube up to 100 feet on a side. You can choose from any of the following effects when you cast this spell. As an action on your turn, you can repeat the same effect or choose a different one.

entries.name: Flood
entries: You cause the water level of all standing water in the area to rise by as much as 20 feet. If the area includes a shore, the flooding water spills over onto dry land.

If you choose an area in a large body of water, you instead create a 20-foot tall wave that travels from one side of the area to the other and then crashes down. Any Huge or smaller vehicles in the wave's path are carried with it to the other side. Any Huge or smaller vehicles struck by the wave have a {@chance 25|||Capsizes!|No effect} chance of capsizing.
The water level remains elevated until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. If this effect produced a wave, the wave repeats on the start of your next turn while the flood effect lasts.

entries.name: Part Water
entries: You cause water in the area to move apart and create a trench. The trench extends across the spell's area, and the separated water forms a wall to either side. The trench remains until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. The water then slowly fills in the trench over the course of the next round until the normal water level is restored.

entries.name: Redirect Flow
entries: You cause flowing water in the area to move in a direction you choose, even if the water has to flow over obstacles, up walls, or in other unlikely directions. The water in the area moves as you direct it, but once it moves beyond the spell's area, it resumes its flow based on the terrain conditions. The water continues to move in the direction you chose until the spell ends or you choose a different effect.

entries.name: Whirlpool
entries: This effect requires a body of water at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep. You cause a whirlpool to form in the center of the area. The whirlpool forms a vortex that is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 50 feet wide at the top, and 25 feet tall. Any creature or object in the water and within 25 feet of the vortex is pulled 10 feet toward it. A creature can swim away from the vortex by making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC.

When a creature enters the vortex for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and is caught in the vortex until the spell ends. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, and isn't caught in the vortex. A creature caught in the vortex can use its action to try to swim away from the vortex as described above, but has disadvantage on the Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to do so.
The first time each turn that an object enters the vortex, the object takes {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage; this damage occurs each round it remains in the vortex.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to "Sight," the size of the cube of water you can control increases to 10 miles, and the spell's duration increases to 24 hours.
In addition to its normal components, the spell requires a {@item rowboat} made of solid gold worth at least 15,000 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Create Food and Water (reckoning)
entries: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of water on the ground or in containers within range, enough to sustain up to fifteen humanoids or five steeds for 24 hours. The food is bland but nourishing, and spoils if uneaten after 24 hours. The water is clean and doesn't go bad.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you instead create 1,500 pounds of food and 1,000 gallons of water, enough to sustain up to 500 humanoids or 166 steeds for 24 hours. The food this spell creates spoils after one week.

In addition to its normal components, the spell requires five silver ingots cast in the shape of bread loaves and two gold ingots cast in the shape of fish, each worth 5,000 gp, each of which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Darkness (reckoning)

components.m: bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

entries: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with {@sense darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to "Sight," its radius increases to 1 mile, its duration increases to 1 year, and it no longer requires {@status concentration}. Magical light, other than the daylight spell cast as a reckoning, cannot dispel this darkness, and if any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell that was not cast as a reckoning, the spell that created the light is dispelled. The darkness travels around corners, ignores cover, and cannot be otherwise hidden, covered, or obscured in any way.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires an onyx worth at least 15,000 gp and a living shadow dragon of any color, both of which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Daylight (reckoning)
entries: A 60-foot-radius sphere of light spreads out from a point you choose within range. The sphere is bright light and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet.

If you chose a point on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the light shines from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the affected object with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the light.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to "Sight," its radius increases to 1 mile, and its duration increases to 1 year. Light produced by this spell is natural sunlight. Magical darkness, other than the darkness spell cast as a reckoning, cannot dispel this light. The light travels around corners, ignores cover, and cannot be otherwise hidden, covered, or obscured in any way.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a sunstone worth at least 15,000 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Dream (reckoning)

components.m: a handful of sand, a dab of ink, and a writing quill plucked from a sleeping bird

entries: This spell shapes a creature's dreams. Choose a creature known to you as the target of this spell. The target must be on the same plane of existence as you. Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, can't be contacted by this spell. You, or a willing creature you touch, enters a trance state, acting as a messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is aware of his or her surroundings, but can't take actions or move.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target's dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the duration of the spell. The messenger can also shape the environment of the dream, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the effect of the spell early. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking. If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it, and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to fall asleep, at which point the messenger appears in the target's dreams.

You can make the messenger appear monstrous and terrifying to the target. If you do, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words and then the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, echoes of the phantasmal monstrosity spawn a nightmare that lasts the duration of the target's sleep and prevents the target from gaining any benefit from that rest. In addition, when the target wakes up, it takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage.
If you have a body part, lock of hair, clipping from a nail, or similar portion of the target's body, the target makes its saving throw with disadvantage.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you can target a 1-mile radius area anywhere on the same plane of existence as you, and its duration increases to 24 hours. Until the spell ends, any sleeping creature in the area receives the message you chose. You can engage in conversation with any target of this spell through the messenger shaped when casting.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires 250 pounds of dried psychedelic mushrooms and an agate worth at least 10,000 gp, both of which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Earthquake (reckoning)

components.m: a pinch of dirt, a piece of rock, and a lump of clay

entries: You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. Each creature on the ground that is {@status concentration||concentrating} must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's {@status concentration} is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend {@status concentration||concentrating} on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.
This spell can have additional effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the DM.

entries.name: Fissures
entries: Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of {@dice 1d6} such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is {@dice 1d10 × 10} feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.
A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

entries.name: Structures
entries: The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a {@dc 20} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become buried.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's range increases "Sight," its radius increases to 1 mile, and its duration increases to 10 minutes.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a living {@creature dao}, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Fire Storm (reckoning)
entries: A storm made up of sheets of roaring flame appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 7d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration increases to "7 days," and its range increases to 1 mile. For the duration, another 10-foot cube of fire emerges from each of the cubes created by the spell, including those created by this method, after 1 minute. At least one of the new cube's faces must be adjacent to one of the existing cubes.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires 50 gallons of lava or magma, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Fortify (reckoning)
entries: A faintly-shimmering dome of force with a radius of up to 1 mile springs into existence around a Huge or larger object or structure that you can see within range. If the target object or structure moves, the dome moves with it.

While outside the dome-shaped barrier, siege engines and Large or larger creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets inside it. Creatures and objects within the barrier have advantage on saving throws against spells and other effects inflicted by creatures and objects outside it.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. If a creature attempts to use teleportation or interplanar travel to enter the barrier, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature can use that magic to enter. On a failure, the creature can't enter and wastes the use of the spell or effect. The barrier also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel.

This spell can only be dispelled by dispel magic or similar effects cast at 5th level or higher while the caster is within the barrier, and must target the object or structure that this spell targets, rather than the barrier itself.
Creatures and objects pass into or out of the barrier without being slowed or damaged. Attacks, spells, and other effects made within the barrier are unaffected by its defenses.

For the duration, the target object or structure gains a +3 bonus to its Armor Class, resistance to all damage, 50 additional hit points that last for the duration, and its Damage Threshold (if it has one) is doubled.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, it no longer requires concentration, and its duration becomes Special. You can use a more valuable material component to cast this spell; for every 1,000 gp of value after the first, its duration increases by 1 day.

m.text: a polished gemstone sphere worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours. When you use a spell slot of 9th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell indefinitely, and creatures and objects outside the barrier cannot make attacks against targets within the barrier.

spell.name: Gate (reckoning)

m.text: a diamond worth at least 5,000 gp

entries: You conjure a portal linking an unoccupied space you can see within range to a precise location on a different plane of existence. The portal is a circular opening, which you can make 5 to 20 feet in diameter. You can orient the portal in any direction you choose. The portal lasts for the duration.

The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal.
Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by this spell from opening in their presence or anywhere within their domains.

When you cast this spell, you can speak the name of a specific creature (a pseudonym, title, or nickname doesn't work). If that creature is on a plane other than the one you are on, the portal opens in the named creature's immediate vicinity and draws the creature through it to the nearest unoccupied space on your side of the portal. You gain no special power over the creature, and it is free to act as the DM deems appropriate. It might leave, attack you, or help you.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its duration increases to "Until Dispelled," and the portal's maximum diameter increases to 100 feet. When you speak the name of a creature as part of casting this spell, the portal that draws it to you remains open. Any creature that fits through the portal can travel through it, entering and exiting on either side, so long as it can squeeze through the portal's dimensions.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a forked gold rod worth at least 10,000 gp attuned to another plane of existence, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Gate Seal (reckoning)

m.text: a broken portal key, which the spell consumes

entries: You fortify the fabric of the planes in a 30-foot cube you can see within range. Within that area, portals close and can't be opened for the duration. Spells and other effects that allow planar travel or open portals, such as {@spell gate} or {@spell plane shift}, fail if used to enter or leave the area. The cube is stationary.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's area changes to a circle with a radius in feet equal to the number of spell slots used to cast it and its duration increases to a year and a day.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a blade taken from the crown of the Lady of Pain, which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Gust of Wind (reckoning)
entries: A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line.
Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a {@chance 50|||Extinguished!|No effect} chance to extinguish them.
As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the line blasts from you.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to 10 miles, the dimensions of the line increase to 1 mile long and 100 feet wide, and its duration increases to 8 hours. The spell also affects structures and objects not being worn or carried in its area, in addition to creatures.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a golden palm frond worth at least 300 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Hallow (reckoning)

m.text: herbs, oils, and incense worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a point and infuse an area around it with holy (or unholy) power. The area can have a radius up to 60 feet, and the spell fails if the radius includes an area already under the effect a hallow spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects.

First, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead can't enter the area, nor can such creatures charm, frighten, or possess creatures within it. Any creature {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by such a creature is no longer {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed upon entering the area. You can exclude one or more of those types of creatures from this effect.

Second, you can bind an extra effect to the area. Choose the effect from the following list, or choose an effect offered by the DM. Some of these effects apply to creatures in the area; you can designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures that follow a specific deity or leader, or creatures of a specific sort, such as orcs or trolls. When a creature that would be affected enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area.

entries.name: Courage
entries: Affected creatures can't be {@condition frightened} while in the area.

entries.name: Darkness
entries: Darkness fills the area. Normal light, as well as magical light created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell, can't illuminate the area.

entries.name: Daylight
entries: Bright light fills the area. Magical darkness created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell can't extinguish the light.

entries.name: Energy Protection
entries: Affected creatures in the area have resistance to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

entries.name: Energy Vulnerability
entries: Affected creatures in the area have vulnerability to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

entries.name: Everlasting Rest
entries: Dead bodies interred in the area can't be turned into undead.

entries.name: Extradimensional Interference
entries: Affected creatures can't move or travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means.

entries.name: Fear
entries: Affected creatures are {@condition frightened} while in the area.

entries.name: Silence
entries: No sound can emanate from within the area, and no sound can reach into it.

entries.name: Tongues
entries: Affected creatures can communicate with any other creature in the area, even if they don't share a common language.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its maximum radius increases to 1 mile, it no longer fails if it overlaps with an area already under the effects of a hallow spell, (you choose which hallow spell affects such areas), and you choose any number of the extra effects, selecting targets for each.
A successful Charisma saving throw ends all extra effects targeting the creature, but it must repeat its saving throw after spending 1 minute in the area, resuming the effects on a failure.

In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires 25,000 pounds of masonry taken from a temple, cathedral, tomb, or other important religious site, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Mass Heal (reckoning)
entries: A flood of healing energy flows from you into injured creatures around you. You restore up to 700 hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures that you can see within range. Creatures healed by this spell are also cured of all diseases and any effect making them {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range expands to 1 mile, you no longer need to see a target to it, and the number of hit points you can restore increases to 10,000.

In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires the heart of a {@filter celestial with a challenge rating of 15 or higher|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&15;&—]|type=celestial|miscellaneous=!adventure npc}, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Meteor Swarm (reckoning)
entries: Blazing orbs of fire plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} fire damage and {@damage 20d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to "Sight," and you conjure a number of meteors equal to the a third of the total levels of slots expended to cast it.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a rock taken from the moon worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Modify Memory (reckoning)
entries: You attempt to reshape another creature's memories. One creature that you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw. If you are fighting the creature, it has advantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. The {@condition charmed} target is {@condition incapacitated} and unaware of its surroundings, though it can still hear you. If it takes any damage or is targeted by another spell, this spell ends, and none of the target's memories are modified.

While this charm lasts, you can affect the target's memory of an event that it experienced within the last 24 hours and that lasted no more than 10 minutes. You can permanently eliminate all memory of the event, allow the target to recall the event with perfect clarity and exacting detail, change its memory of the details of the event, or create a memory of some other event.

You must speak to the target to describe how its memories are affected, and it must be able to understand your language for the modified memories to take root. Its mind fills in any gaps in the details of your description. If the spell ends before you have finished describing the modified memories, the creature's memory isn't altered. Otherwise, the modified memories take hold when the spell ends.

A modified memory doesn't necessarily affect how a creature behaves, particularly if the memory contradicts the creature's natural inclinations, alignment, or beliefs. An illogical modified memory, such as implanting a memory of how much the creature enjoyed dousing itself in acid, is dismissed, perhaps as a bad dream. The DM might deem a modified memory too nonsensical to affect a creature in a significant manner.
A {@spell remove curse} or {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the target restores the creature's true memory.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range changes to "Self (500-foot radius) and you can target any number of creatures within the area, which you do not have to see. You can modify a memory from any point in the targets' lives, but it must involve memories about the same event. The event can affect the targets' memories of an event that lasted up to a year.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires the corpse of an elder brain, which the spell consumes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can alter the target's memories of an event that took place up to 7 days ago (6th level), 30 days ago (7th level), 1 year ago (8th level), or any time in the creature's past (9th level).

spell.name: Phantasmal Force (reckoning)
entries: You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature.

The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm. For example, a target attempting to walk across a phantasmal bridge that spans a chasm falls once it steps onto the bridge. If the target survives the fall, it still believes that the bridge exists and comes up with some other explanation for its fall—it was pushed, it slipped, or a strong wind might have knocked it off.

An affected target is so convinced of the phantasm's reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. A phantasm created to appear as a creature can attack the target. Similarly, a phantasm created to appear as fire, a pool of acid, or lava can burn the target. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5 feet of the phantasm, provided that the illusion is of a creature or hazard that could logically deal damage, such as by attacking. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to 1 mile, its duration increases to 24 hours, and it affects any number of creatures within range.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a master artist such as a painter, writer, poet, or orator, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Plane Shift (reckoning)

m.text: a forked, metal rod worth at least 250 gp, attuned to a particular plane of existence

entries: You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination. If you are trying to reach the City of Brass, for example, you might arrive in its Street of Steel, before its Gate of Ashes, or looking at the city from across the Sea of Fire, at the DM's discretion.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

You can use this spell to banish an unwilling creature to another plane. Choose a creature within your reach and make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If the creature fails this save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you choose any two areas of equal size on two different planes of existence. You must have visited both locations at once before, and the areas you choose must fit entirely within a 1-mile radius sphere. The area in one plane disappears and reappears in the second area's location, and the second area appears in the first area's location in the same instant.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires two tuning forks of solid gold each worth at least 5,000 gp (one attuned to each plane), which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Plant Growth (reckoning)
entries: This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.
You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's area increases to a 1-mile radius and the duration of the enrichment it applies to crops in the area lasts for 100 years. Each affected plant is immune to disease and damage from beasts or undead. Extreme weather cannot harm the affected plants, which can survive near-impossible conditions while within the affected area. These plants are also immune to the {@spell blight} and {@spell Abi-Dalzim's horrid wilting|xge} spells, unless the latter is cast as a reckoning.

spell.name: Psychic Scream (reckoning)
entries: You unleash the power of your mind to blast the intellect of up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Creatures that have an Intelligence score of 2 or lower are unaffected.

Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 14d6} psychic damage and is {@condition stunned}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. If a target is killed by this damage, its head explodes, assuming it has one.
A {@condition stunned} target can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to 10 miles, you no longer need to see the targets, its saving throw DC increases to 21 if it is not already higher, and it targets 100 creatures for every spell slot used to cast the spell as a reckoning. The spell does no damage when cast in this way.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a living {@creature neothelid|vgm}, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Sickening Radiance (reckoning)
entries: Dim, greenish light spreads within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The light spreads around corners, and it lasts until the spell ends.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} radiant damage, and it suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} and emits a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being {@condition invisible}. The light and any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, its range increases to "Sight," its area increases to a 1-mile-radius sphere, its duration becomes "Until Dispelled," and it no longer requires {@status concentration}. Objects within the area taken outside the area emanate the spell's radiation in a 15-foot radius around them until the spell ends.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a chunk of uranium worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Soul Cage (reckoning)

time.condition: which you take when a humanoid you can see within 60 feet of you dies

m.text: a tiny silver cage worth 100 gp

entries: This spell snatches the soul of a humanoid as it dies and traps it inside the tiny cage you use for the material component. A stolen soul remains inside the cage until the spell ends or until you destroy the cage, which ends the spell. While you have a soul inside the cage, you can exploit it in any of the ways described below. You can use a trapped soul up to six times. Once you exploit a soul for the sixth time, it is released, and the spell ends. While a soul is trapped, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

entries.name: Steal Life
entries: You can use a bonus action to drain vigor from the soul and regain {@dice 2d8} hit points.

entries.name: Query Soul
entries: You ask the soul a question (no action required) and receive a brief telepathic answer, which you can understand regardless of the language used. The soul knows only what it knew in life, but it must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. The answer is no more than a sentence or two and might be cryptic.

entries.name: Borrow Experience
entries: You can use a bonus action to bolster yourself with the soul's life experience, making your next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage. If you don't use this benefit before the start of your next turn, it is lost.

entries.name: Eyes of the Dead
entries: You can use an action to name a place the humanoid saw in life, which creates an {@condition invisible} sensor somewhere in that place if it is on the plane of existence you're currently on. The sensor remains for as long as you concentrate, up to 10 minutes (as if you were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). You receive visual and auditory information from the sensor as if you were in its space using your senses.
A creature that can see the sensor (such as one using {@spell see invisibility} or {@sense truesight}) sees a translucent image of the tormented humanoid whose soul you caged.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you alter the cage used to cast soul cage, granting you an additional way to exploit the soul after casting the spell normally:

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries: If you die, you can exploit the soul all six times to send it to the appropriate afterlife in place of yours. You gain 1 hit point and 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} (to a maximum of 5), and suffer one {@table Lingering Injuries|DMG|lingering injury} appropriate for the damage that killed you.

spell.name: Storm of Vengeance (reckoning)
entries: A churning storm cloud forms, centered on a point you can see and spreading to a radius of 360 feet. Lightning flashes in the area, thunder booms, and strong winds roar. Each creature under the cloud (no more than 5,000 feet beneath the cloud) when it appears must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} for 5 minutes.
Each round you maintain {@status concentration} on this spell, the storm produces different effects on your turn.

entries.name: Round 2
entries: Acidic rain falls from the cloud. Each creature and object under the cloud takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage.

entries.name: Round 3
entries: You call six bolts of lightning from the cloud to strike six creatures or objects of your choice beneath the cloud. A given creature or object can't be struck by more than one bolt. A struck creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Round 4
entries: Hailstones rain down from the cloud. Each creature under the cloud takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Round 5–10
entries: Gusts and freezing rain assail the area under the cloud. The area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and is {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2||heavily obscured}. Each creature there takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage. Ranged weapon attacks in the area are impossible. The wind and rain count as a severe distraction for the purposes of maintaining {@status concentration} on spells. Finally, gusts of strong wind (ranging from 20 to 50 miles per hour) automatically disperse fog, mists, and similar phenomena in the area, whether mundane or magical.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's duration changes to "24 hours" and no longer requires {@status concentration}. On the first round after 10 rounds pass, the storm requires a Constitution saving throw against thunder damage as it did when it was cast. It then repeats its effects each round until you choose to end it.
In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires 10 {@item javelin of lightning|dmg|javelins of lightning}, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Skywrite (reckoning)
entries: You cause up to ten words to form in a part of the sky you can see. The words appear to be made of cloud and remain in place for the spell's duration. The words dissipate when the spell ends. A strong wind can disperse the clouds and end the spell early.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, you can write up to 100 words, the spell no longer requires concentration, and its duration becomes "Until Dispelled."

In addition to its normal components, casting this spell as a reckoning requires a {@creature smoke mephit|mm|smoke} or {@creature steam mephit} for every 10 words written (rounded up), which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Whirlwind (reckoning)
entries: A whirlwind howls down to a point that you can see on the ground within range. The whirlwind is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up any Medium or smaller objects that aren't secured to anything and that aren't worn or carried by anyone.

A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlwind or that the whirlwind enters its space, including when the whirlwind first appears. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a Large or smaller creature that fails the save must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} in the whirlwind until the spell ends. When a creature starts its turn {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind, the creature is pulled 5 feet higher inside it, unless the creature is at the top. A {@condition restrained} creature moves with the whirlwind and falls when the spell ends, unless the creature has some means to stay aloft.

A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC. If successful, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind and is hurled {@dice 3d6 × 10} feet away from it in a random direction.

entries.name: As a Reckoning
entries: When you cast this spell {@book as a reckoning|AbiDalzims|9|Reckoning Spells}, the spell's range increases to "Sight," the cylinder's height and width increase to up to 1 mile, and its duration increases to 8 hours. The spell also affects structures and objects that aren't being worn or carried.

spell.name: Time Stop (reckoning)
